messages.title: Dear resident,
messages.content: In this general election, you have a choice about the kind of MP you want for our area.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Oppose any cuts to the funding of Lancaster’s universities.
Plan to work closely with the City Council and local residents' groups, such as It’s Our City, to make our local environment cleaner and greener.
Support electoral reform, seriously considering the replacement of the House of Lords with a new second chamber elected under proportional representation.
Believe the NHS is the fairest healthcare system in the world.
Afford the same rights under the law, including the right of lesbians and gay men to marry; and opposed to threats to our civil liberties, such as the (now shelved) ID cards plan.

mentions.tacticalSituation: This is a very close race between Labour and the Conservatives, and every vote will make a real difference to the outcome.

issues.economy: The greatest issue facing everyone right now is the future of the economy.
issues.environment: Another big concern for Lancastrians is the environment.
issues.governance: I also take seriously the need to bring our system of government up to date.
issues.health: I believe the NHS is the fairest healthcare system in the world;

quotes.text: I support the stance our government has taken on the economy, protecting those hardest hit.

images.caption: Clive Grunshaw, Labour candidate for Lancaster and Fleetwood
